Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired reddish); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Very little remains of the sherd. the steep incline of the foot suggests that it is later than the chalices in the Wild Goat Style. The number 362 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0677) (phase 2)
